Stereotype.name: compu
Stereotype.notes: This meta-class represents the ability to express one particular computation

Tag.name: compuContent
Tag.description: This specifies the details of the computation.

Tag.name: compuDefaultValue
Tag.description: This property can be used to specify an output value for a conversion formula, if the value to be converted lies outside the plausibility limit. Although this is possible for all conversion formulae, it is especially valid for variables with tabular conversion formulae.

Stereotype.name: compuconst
Stereotype.notes: This meta-class represents the fact that the value of a computation method scale is constant.

Tag.name: compuConstContentType
Tag.description: This is the actual content of the constant compu method scale.

Stereotype.name: compucontent
Stereotype.notes: This abstract meta-class represents the various definition means of a computation method.

Stereotype.name: compumethod
Stereotype.notes:
This meta-class represents the ability to express the relationship between a physical value and the mathematical representation.
Note that this is still independent of the technical implementation in data types. It only specifies the formula how the internal value corresponds to its physical pendant.
Tags:atp.recommendedPackage=CompuMethods

Tag.name: compuInternalToPhys
Tag.description: This specifies the computation from internal values to physical values.

Tag.name: compuPhysToInternal
Tag.description: This represents the computation from physical values to the internal values.

Stereotype.name: compunominatordenominator
Stereotype.notes: This class represents the ability to express a polynomial either as Nominator or as Denominator.

Stereotype.name: compurationalcoeffs
Stereotype.notes: This meta-class represents the ability to express a rational function by specifying the coefficients of nominator and denominator.

Tag.name: compuDenominator
Tag.description: This is the denominator of the expression.

Tag.name: compuNumerator
Tag.description: This is the numerator of the rational expression

Stereotype.name: compuscale
Stereotype.notes: This meta-class represents the ability to specify one segment of a segmented computation method.

Tag.name: compuInverseValue
Tag.description: This is the inverse value of the constraint. This supports the case that the scale is not reversible per se.

Tag.name: compuScaleContents
Tag.description: This represents the computation details of the scale.

Stereotype.name: compuscaleconstantcontents
Stereotype.notes: This meta-class represents the fact that a particular scale of the computation method is constant.

Stereotype.name: compuscalecontents
Stereotype.notes: This abstract meta-class represents the content of one particular scale.

Stereotype.name: compuscalerationalformula
Stereotype.notes: This meta-class represents the fact that the computation in this scale is represented as rational term.

Tag.name: compuScale
Tag.description:
This represents one scale within the compu method.
Note that it contains a Variationpoint in order to support blueprints of enumerations.
